@Chadly: almost every city in the US has the huge multiplex theaters. . as you are describing in your comment, I'll quote you - "WHAT? $1? Where is this theater? Almost $15 here and if you wanna buy snacks looking at like $40-50 lol thats just pop, popcorn and a chocolate bar lol :P" Now that it has been established that there ARE theaters like YOU,(@Chadly) described, with the 15 dollar a ticket prices and so on. WELL @Chadly, who ever you are, just because you are ignorant of something's existence doesn't mean it doesn't exist. . . Who the fuck are you??? 
There ARE, at least here in the US, "Dollar Theaters".  These are smaller (not in screen size but smaller in the number of theaters in one complex). There may be only 2 or 4 theaters in the same building, and the movies they are playing are the same MOVIES that were in all the other theaters, but are no longer drawing the big crowds like when it was a newer release. So basically, these "DOLLAR THEATERS show the same movies, but only when the BIGGER theaters are done with them.  At this point they goto the "DOLLAR THEATERS". 
It is a plan HATCHED by the BIG TIME studios in HOLLYWOOD in the early 80's. The idea was to squeeze every penny out of all there movies as they caould, so began the "DOLLAR THEATER". Having said that, to be more precise, the tickets now cost around $2 or $3 dollars a ticket, but the SLANG given to these theaters by the American public stuck and are still called "DOLLAR THEATERS" to this very day.
SO to you, or ANYONE else that is so clueless as to not understand what a "DOLLAR" theater is, ABOVE is your explanation.
